reviewText:
Early Access Review

If u liked  Sonic & all-stars racing or Skydrift ,Altitude0
is a must-have arcade/racing game.No,it doesnt have
guns like the titles above but it doesnt lack in anything.
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Traps in the flags and aero tricks give a nice playthrough.
The game modes are: solo license,championship mode
and users tracks.Variety in the difficulty of maps,though
a new content / update is always welcomed.

+ Able to choose control modes (arcade and advanced
mode for more simulated flying)

+ The  menu interface seems polished

+ Steam inventory drops,not necessary feature but its still nice to see

+ Superb soundtrack

+ Track editor is available,a good way for new content

~ Online features exist but not many players out there yet
(AI exist though,with rankings from ghost players/other users scores)
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Overall,i would recommend this game,it gets often
updated so far,hope to see new content/updates in future
(for planes,enviroment-maps,plane parts etc)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a fun and fast paced flying game with a focus on speed and altitude. It drops items that can be sold on the Steam market.
This game has very nice graphics as well as Devs that are present and allowing the community to help shape the game. Support this game!
voteText: 11 of 14 people (79%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI don't remember when was last time when I truly enjoyed racing game with planes. Even tho it's more of arcade game than simulator, it's really great. It's fun to complete training and gaining title of A0 Master, it's fun to beat weekly/overall records of certain maps and compete with others, it's fun to play on multiplayer and singleplayer. Sadly, there aren't many players and mostly you will play alone (you can do that on both single and multi option) but I hope it will change after game will leave early access. You can also customize your plane with special skins and stickers, which drops weekly like in CS:GO. With team of 2 people updates are going rather slowly but there is tracks editor, so if you think there aren't enough maps you can try yourself at making one. Even if this game is still in early access, it's at playable stage. I think Altitude0: Lower & Faster as final product will be something great.
voteText: 11 of 14 people (79%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nHi! Please read the previous helpful customer reviews, because I couldn't agree more with their recommendations. Stick with Advanced plane control mode (though) and you will soon become one of best pilots around. We are trying to build strong community, with weekly multiplayer events, building user tracks... I'm sure broadcasting the MP events will bring some more pilots. Small dev team has definately developed a big game with an altitude :-)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Trackmania with planes!

In Altitude0 you race against the ghosts of other players on many different, and some whacky, tracks. At the current version there are three planes to choose from, all with slightly variying characteristics.

Having spent more time with the game now, seeing the development pace, a small review correction was in line - the pilot wings experience i was talking about could still be achieved, but i don´t think it is going to happen soon´ish =)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Altitude0 is one of those games that you just keep on coming back to over and over again. Thing is, everytime I do strap back in - the game's developers keep packing on the content and refinements to an already great game.

Jump in Early Access - you'll be glad that you did!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Very challenging skill based game.
Would suggest to use advanced user settings and practice tail rudders first and then wing rudders on tutorials to attain mastery over plane movement control and then attempt to sync for a new comer.
Takes a while to get used to the controls but once you get a hang of it you cant stop making podium finishes in races which is when the fun really starts.
Has lot of customizations,tracks,leader boards,skins,custom races,replays and multiplayer.
Ideal game to bring friends over at home and play against one another.
Nice music,scenery and plane animations.
Also lots of new developments still rolling out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Quick review of the game:

With the current ammount of content I find the game really fun and challenging.
It is still on Early Access but don't let that fool you into thinking it's a shell of a game..There is plenty of action into it with alot more coming!

I own Sky Drift too (A similiar game in a way) but I always come back to Altitude0!
I am hoping for some more mainstreaming the UI and the fix for the lighting in the night because it's currently blinding to fly at night

As as mechanics the game is really polished (Need more realistic flying model? Just go to options and select the difficulty setting) + the soundtrack is good too (Some more songs will be great too)
The online aspect is really cool too.Personally I am quite high in the ranks!

About the items and P2W: There is no P2W here its all cosmetics that you can buy (Skins for your planes+stickers) You unlock parts in the single player challenges!

I think this game is worthy of your time if you love flying planes!
As of 12/20/2014 I rate the game a solid 8.5/10

Cheers to developer!
